sub_topic: Identifying the Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph: 

```
A --- B --- C
|           |
D --- E --- F 
```

Is there a Hamiltonian path in this graph? If yes, provide the sequence of vertices in the path. If no, explain why not.
message_2:
Yes, there is a Hamiltonian path in this graph. A Hamiltonian path is a path that visits each vertex exactly once. One possible Hamiltonian path in this graph is:

A - B - C - F - E - D
